title: Pak buckles in PoK: Sharif govt, protesters sign pact - what's in the deal?
content: Protests in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir concluded after an agreement. The Pakistan government and protestors signed a 25-point charter. This followed days of violence and unrest in the region. The deal includes compensation for victims and significant developmental measures. Key provisions cover education, health, and electricity improvements. Administrative reforms and infrastructure projects are also part of the agreement.

title: Bulldozers roll in Bareilly: House linked to Raza sealed; 'Raja Palace' demolished
content: Bareilly authorities conducted demolition and anti-encroachment drives following recent clashes. Raza Palace, a marriage hall, was demolished for building norm violations, and a house allegedly sheltering Maulana Tauqeer Raza during the violence was sealed. Unauthorized shop and house extensions were also removed in Sailani.

title: 'Trying to steal Jan Nayak title': PM slams Rahul; blames RJD for Bihar's woes
content: Prime Minister Modi inaugurated significant education and skilling projects in Bihar, including the Jan Nayak Karpoori Thakur Skill University. He subtly criticized Rahul Gandhi over the 'Jan Nayak' title and launched PM-SETU worth Rs 60,000 crore, alongside other youth-centric initiatives, while blaming previous RJD rule for educational woes.

title: Pak woos US: After rare earth & crypto, Munir offers port deal to Trump
content: Advisers to Pakistan‚Äôs military chief proposed a $1.2 billion port at Pasni to US officials, aiming to transport critical minerals and offer Washington a strategic presence. This initiative, part of a broader effort to strengthen ties with the Trump administration, seeks to diversify Pakistan's options and counterbalance China's influence.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; scheduled services will..
content: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years after Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. Despite this, the US Embassy in India confirmed that scheduled visa and passport services will continue. The embassy's X account will only provide urgent safety and security updates during this period.

title: 'Second-best after Dhoni': Sehwag lauds Rohit; Mumbai batter removed as ODI skipper
content: Indian selectors have replaced Rohit Sharma with Shubman Gill as ODI captain for the upcoming Australia series, signaling long-term preparations for the 2027 World Cup. Despite the leadership change, Rohit remains in the squad, with cricketing legends praising his tactical acumen and ability to foster team unity, highlighting his continued importance to Team India.

title: Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli fit and key for India: Ajit Agarkar
content: BCCI chief selector Ajit Agarkar confirmed Shubman Gill as India's new ODI captain, consolidating leadership across formats. Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will remain key players for the Australia tour, having passed fitness tests, despite playing only one format. Rohit is expected to open with Gill, balancing experience with fresh leadership.

title: US Army warns: Military network at ‚Äòvery high risk‚Äô; sends memo to these companies
content: The US Army's chief technology officer issued a memo labeling the new NGC2 battlefield communications network, developed by Palantir and Anduril, as "very high risk" due to fundamental security flaws. Concerns include uncontrolled data access, unmonitored user actions, and unverified software security, potentially allowing adversaries persistent access and misuse of classified information.

title: 'Practically impossible to avoid': Agarkar on Gill taking over ODI reins from Rohit
content: Shubman Gill has been named India's ODI captain, replacing Rohit Sharma, as part of a strategic move to consolidate leadership across formats. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar cited long-term planning for the 2027 World Cup and the impracticality of having three different captains. Gill, already Test captain, also serve as T20I vice-captain under Suryakumar Yadav.

title: Life lesson: JPMorgan CEO recalls emergency surgery; made him realise he had no regrets
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon's emergency heart surgery in 2020 profoundly reshaped his perspective on leadership and life. Facing a life-threatening moment, he realized he had no regrets about his choices. This experience now drives him to prioritize purpose, empathy, and long-term thinking, believing future leaders should inspire and unify.

title: Monk robes to veg food: Delhi 'godman' makes demands in jail; charges added to FIR
content: Self-styled godman Swami Chaitanyananda was remanded to 14 days judicial custody by a Delhi court over sexual harassment allegations at a management institute. Police added a charge for threatening a woman after the case was registered. His counsel sought preservation of evidence and specific provisions for his stay, on which the court sought police response.

title: Emma Raducanu‚Äôs IG nod to Taylor Swift‚Äôs ‚ÄòThe Life of a Showgirl‚Äô
content: Emma Raducanu publicly supported Taylor Swift's new album, "The Life of a Showgirl," on Instagram on October 3, 2025, amidst its mixed reception. This gesture followed Raducanu's mixed 2025 tennis season, which included recent losses but also a strong semifinal performance. Her musical interests connect her with fans beyond the court.

title: Bihar polls by Oct-end? EC holds all-party meet; suggestions on dates, phases
content: The Election Commission met political parties on Saturday. They discussed Bihar assembly polls. Parties urged polls after the Chhath festival. They also asked for fewer phases. Reforms like voter cap and Form 17C were welcomed. Janata Dal (United) sought a single-phase election. BJP asked agents to collect Form 17C. Election dates will be announced soon.

title: Arthur Jones cause of death: How did the Ravens‚Äô Super Bowl champion die at 39
content: Former NFL star and Super Bowl champion Arthur Jones died suddenly at 39, with his cause of death unconfirmed. A key defensive player in the Baltimore Ravens' Super Bowl XLVII victory, his passing deeply saddened the sports world. Jones, from a renowned athletic family, is remembered for his positive spirit and legacy.

title: Giants star Malik Nabers slams 'broken justice system' LSU teammate's tragic death
content: Giants rookie Malik Nabers expressed anguish over former LSU teammate Kyren Lacy's tragic death by suicide, which occurred a day before a grand jury hearing. Lacy faced negligent homicide charges, but his attorney claimed new evidence showed innocence. Nabers criticized the justice system and media for destroying reputations before facts are known.

title: Stephen A. Smith on Shedeur Sanders‚Äô 'silence' amid Browns QB drama
content: Shedeur Sanders made headlines in Cleveland on October 1, 2025. He remained silent during a press conference. Stephen A. Smith defended his actions, calling judgment unfair. Cam Newton discussed Sanders' brand value for the Browns. Both analysts agreed his true test would come only when he steps onto the field.

title: ‚ÄòOp Gaanjaney‚Äô: How ATS tracked ex-NSG commando in 200kg drug bust; kingpin had political ambitions
content: Rajasthan ATS apprehended former NSG commando Bajrang Singh, wanted in a 200kg ganja smuggling case. Singh, who served in the 26/11 Mumbai operation and retired in 2021, became a narcotics kingpin, leveraging local connections after failed political ambitions. He was tracked for two months using technical intelligence and informers, culminating in his arrest under 'Operation Gaanjaney'.

title: First major legal challenge hits Trump‚Äôs $100K H-1B visa overhaul - Here‚Äôs what to know
content: A coalition of unions, educators, and advocacy groups has filed the first major lawsuit against President Trump‚Äôs $100,000 H-1B visa fee, calling it unlawful and harmful to US industries. Filed in California federal court, the case challenges presidential authority, citing risks to innovation, healthcare, and education. The outcome could reshape immigration policy and global talent flow.

title: Ind vs Aus: Harbhajan questions Rohit's removal as ODI captain; expresses 'disappointment'
content: Harbhajan Singh lauds Shubman Gill‚Äôs new ODI captaincy but voices disappointment over Rohit Sharma being replaced, emphasizing his experience and pivotal role in white-ball cricket.

title: Sean Combs case: Meet Arun Subramanian? Indian-origin judge who sentenced ‚ÄòDiddy‚Äô to 4 yrs in jail
content: District Judge Arun Subramanian sentenced Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs to 50 months in prison and a $500,000 fine for prostitution-related offenses, citing his history of violence. Subramanian, a 45-year-old Indian-origin judge appointed by President Biden, earned praise for his measured yet firm handling of the high-profile trial, maintaining decorum amidst intense public scrutiny.

title: Trump's Gaza plan: Israel prepares for '1st stage'; what is the 20-point proposal?
content: Hamas partially accepted President Trump's peace plan for Gaza, expressing readiness for immediate talks on hostage release and ending the conflict. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu also prepared to implement the plan's first stage. The proposal outlines a deradicalized Gaza, technocratic governance, and a pathway to Palestinian self-determination, with Trump overseeing redevelopment efforts.

title: Maoists must surrender by March 2026, says Amit Shah in Chhattisgarh
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has set a firm March 2026 deadline for Maoists to surrender, stating talks will only be considered after they lay down arms. He warned of intensified operations if they fail to comply, emphasizing Bastar's desire for peace and development.

title: Cough syrup row: Tests confirm presence of poisonous chemical; MP bans sale of 'Coldrif'
content: Seven children in Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara district died from consuming Coldrif cough syrup, confirmed to contain the toxic industrial chemical diethylene glycol (DEG). Following Tamil Nadu lab test results, the Madhya Pradesh government banned Coldrif and all products by Sresan Pharmaceuticals, ordering immediate statewide seizure of stocks.

title: 'Roots infested with insects': PM slams Congress-RJD for Bihar's 'migration crisis'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticised previous RJD-Congress governments for Bihar's education system devastation and mass migration, crediting CM Nitish Kumar and the NDA for its revival. He highlighted 10 lakh new government jobs, a significantly increased education budget, and launched youth-oriented projects worth over ‚Çπ62,000 crore, including a new skill university and revamped student schemes.

title: Japan to get first woman PM: Sanae Takaichi elected LDP leader; known for hard-line China stance
content: Sanae Takaichi was elected leader of Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party. She is now the most likely candidate to become Japan's first female prime minister. Takaichi defeated Shinjiro Koizumi in a runoff vote. She replaces Shigeru Ishiba. Takaichi served under Shinzo Abe. She shares his nationalist views and seeks military modernisation.

title: US shutdown: Military families seek food aid as WH warns of wider impact
content: The US government shutdown continues for a third day. Military families face financial anxiety and seek food assistance. White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt highlights impacts on 1.3 million service members unpaid. WIC programs and air traffic controllers also face jeopardy. The shutdown could cost the US economy billions weekly. Lawmakers have not reached a resolution.

title: 'Demanding Rs 30k maintenance on Rs 12k salary': Man brutally beaten by in-laws
content: Kunal, who married against his in-laws' wishes, was brutally assaulted in Sonipat by his wife's father, uncle, and associates. His arms and legs were broken after he posted marriage photos online, which angered the family who had allegedly arranged her second marriage. Police registered an FIR, and Kunal is undergoing treatment.

title: Hostage release but ... : Hamas agrees to Trump‚Äôs Gaza peace plan with conditions - What are they?
content: Hamas partially accepted Donald Trump's Gaza peace plan, agreeing to release all Israeli hostages if conditions are met. However, the group seeks further negotiations on crucial clauses concerning Gaza's future governance, Israeli withdrawal, and its own role. Trump urged Israel to halt bombing for hostage release, while warning of severe consequences if the deal ultimately fails.

title: 'Why would he visit at night?': Dalit man wanting to go to temple assaulted; FIR filed
content: A Dalit labourer was allegedly assaulted and threatened in Himatnagar after expressing a wish to visit a temple. Upon showing his Aadhaar card, an accused subjected him to casteist slurs and physical abuse, questioning his presence as a Dalit. He was later driven away and warned against returning, prompting an FIR under the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.

title: ‚ÄòJabo de‚Äô: Bandmate recalls Zubeen Garg‚Äôs final moments; alleges he was frothing at mouth
content: Singer Zubeen Garg died under mysterious circumstances. His manager Siddharth Sharma faces arrest. Witnesses allege poisoning and criminal conspiracy. Sharma reportedly dismissed symptoms during Garg's final moments. He allegedly controlled the yacht and supplied liquor. Other statements corroborate Sharma's actions. Financial records and witness accounts establish culpability. Police now treat this as a premeditated murder.

title: 'Confiscate diplomatic passport': Nishikant hits out at Rahul over Colombia speech
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey demanded the confiscation of Rahul Gandhi's diplomatic passport and legal action, following Gandhi's criticism of the Indian government's "attack on Indian democracy" during a visit to Colombia. Dubey compared Gandhi's "baseless statements" to controversial figures, also slamming Congress for opposing climate activist Sonam Wangchuk's NSA arrest and recalling the party's historical actions during the Emergency.

title: U'khand: 22-yr-old merchant navy‚Äôs senior deck cadet goes missing at sea; search ops on
content: A 22-year-old senior deck cadet, Karandeep Singh Rana, went missing from a merchant navy vessel. The ship was traveling from Iraq to China via Sri Lanka and Singapore. His family last contacted him on September 20. The shipping company confirmed his disappearance overboard. A 96-hour search operation was conducted. The vessel is now heading to China for a full investigation.

title: US firm fires Indian staff in 4 minutes; offers 8 coping tips for layoffs
content: A US-based company recently laid off its Indian workforce in just four minutes during a virtual meeting, leaving employees shocked and unprepared. Beyond the financial impact, the emotional toll was severe. The focus is on the human side of sudden layoffs and eight practical coping strategies including financial planning, career rebuilding, and mental well-being to help professionals manage unexpected job loss.

title: Kidney transplant breakthrough: Scientists create universal donor kidney
content: Scientists converted a type A kidney into a type O universal donor kidney. Enzymes removed specific antigens from the organ. The converted kidney worked normally for two days in a brain-dead patient. Antigens then reappeared. This research shows a path to reduce kidney transplant waiting times. It could benefit many type O patients.

title: Karur Stampede: Stalin promises SOP; TN CM says it will serve as model for entire nation
content: Chief Minister MK Stalin addressed the Karur stampede, which killed 41 during actor Vijay's campaign, announcing a comprehensive SOP and a Special Investigation Team. He affirmed the state's commitment to accountability and preventing future tragedies, urging stakeholders to unite for a long-term solution.

title: ‚ÄòStarting to diversify‚Äô: Is India cutting back on Russian oil? What Trump aide said
content: US trade representative Jamieson Greer claimed India is diversifying from Russian oil, despite a 50% tariff imposed, half of which targets India's recent surge in Russian oil purchases. Conversely, Russian President Vladimir Putin asserted India will continue energy imports from Russia, suggesting increased Russian imports of Indian goods to balance trade.

title: Poll-bound Bihar in focus: PM unveils Rs 62,000cr youth-focused initiatives
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi unveiled youth-centric initiatives exceeding Rs 62,000 crore, significantly impacting poll-bound Bihar. Key launches include the Rs 60,000 crore PM-SETU scheme to modernize ITIs, new vocational labs, and enhanced financial aid for students. Modi also inaugurated a skill university and dedicated NIT Patna's Bihta campus, underscoring a commitment to youth empowerment and skill development.

title: Outrageous! Sahibzada Farhan unveils controversial AK-47 ‚Äògunmode‚Äô sticker
content: Sahibzada Farhan unveiled a new "Gunmode" bat sticker, inspired by his controversial AK-47 celebration against India during the Asia Cup. Despite Pakistan's team collapse and loss, Farhan was felicitated for these theatrics. Critics argue such personal flair overshadows sportsmanship and true cricketing achievement, a trend reinforced by his new sticker.

title: Meerut: Cloth trader shot dead by friends; accused uploads video online
content: Meerut: A 25-year-old man was allegedly shot dead by his friends in a forested area, with the gruesome act recorded and circulated online. Police suspect Mohd Adil was lured and killed over suspicions of betraying rivals in a previous murder.

title: Rarest of rare: 'Foetus-in-foetus‚Äô baby delivered at Karnataka hospital
content: Karnataka Medical College and Research Institute successfully delivered a baby with a rare "foetus-to-foetus" condition on September 23. An inner, undeveloped foetus, described as a parasitic twin with rudimentary spine and skull, was found within the newborn. Both mother and baby are stable. Doctors deem this a "rarest of the rare" case, planning further tests and documentation for medical journals.

title: Cash & jewellery looted: 2 Indians arrested for robbing sex workers in Singapore hotel
content: Two Indian men, Arokkiyasami Daison and Rajendran Mayilarasan, were sentenced to five years and one month in prison with 12 strokes of the cane in Singapore. They pleaded guilty to assaulting and robbing two women in hotel rooms after being approached by a man offering sex workers. The men cited financial hardship as their motive for the crimes.

title: Haaland on pace to surpass Messi and Ronaldo's best seasons. Is that good for City?
content: pep Guardiola was trying to verbalize what made his team so different from their competitors . his wingers defended like defensive midfielders, his attacking midfielders facilitated the central runs of his wales . he said: "we play leftist football"

content: the Buffalo Bills will rock their all-white "Cold Front" threads against the new England Patriots on "Sunday Night Football" there's a chrome, iridescent charging buffalo on the sleeves and a buffalo as a helmet decal .

title: Seattle Mariners' crab helmet tops 2025 new ballpark grub
content: baseball teams are becoming more innovative and stepping up their food game in 2025 . the Seattle Mariners have a helmet full of crab claws for the postseason . they have an exclusive jaws milkshake and souvenir cup to celebrate the movie's 50th anniversary .

title: Rollins creates more animosity with Cody, Orton
content: seth Rollins continues to question himself and be fueled by his desire for revenge and validation . the vision def. cody Rhodes and Randy Orton defeated Rhodes . a stomp on Orton was an interesting end because it adds another layer of animosity .

title: Don't be surprised if ... Cook leads RBs in season scoring, Daniels is top-five QB
content: field Yates has Deebo Samuel as a top-20 fantasy wide receiver in week 5 against the Chargers . all mentions of fantasy points are for PPR formats, unless otherwise noted . RB James Cook rushed for 16 touchdowns last season, but seven running backs scored more .

title: Women's Bracketology: UConn projects as top overall seed with one month to season
content: a month before the 2025-26 season opens, there's a fresh look at what may look like . if we last forecasted the bracket in April, the UConn Huskies had just been crowned champions . it's the big news as we enter the final months before the season .

title: Air Force's alternate uniforms inspired by F-16 headline top threads for Week 6
content: the threads will be worn for the first time Saturday as air force faces a fellow service academy . the uniforms' connection with the F-16 is extensive, with tributes to the fighter jet everywhere from the helmet to the pants . details on the jersey include two patches for the player's name .

title: Knicks legends ride camels, 76ers go golfing: Top scenes from Abu Dhabi series
content: the new york Knicks and Philadelphia 76ers are in Abu Dhabi for a preseason doubleheader beginning Thursday . the trip marks the fourth year of the NBA's games in the united arab Emirates . they were greeted with singing from locals and a quick drink .

title: Why Tommy Castellanos sets up FSU for success vs. Miami
content: a storm brewing in Tallahassee, and it's more than just the weather forecast . one team thrives on pressure, while the other thrives in it . what happens Saturday could reshape the entire ACC title race .

title: Why Alabama could move ahead early against Vandy
content: all odds by ESPN BET No. 16 Vanderbilt Commodores at no. 10 Alabama Crimson Tide at 3:30 p.m. ET, ABC Line: Alabama -10.5, 3-1 . a 5-0 win over alabama puts the team ahead of the playoffs . it's the kind of matchup that makes you pause before firing a bet .

title: Top regression candidates for 2025-26: Geekie, Scheifele, more
content: last season, there were plenty of opportunities for regression, given what occurred during the 2023-24 season . candidates for regression include those most likely to see a 10+% drop in production, whether it's goals or points, based on their situations .

title: Bama's shot at revenge, high stakes in the ACC and the 29 biggest games of Week 6
content: it feels like we know less about the college football landscape now than we did a month ago . it's into this murky world that we wade for Week 6 . last week boasted serious headliners that clarified the Big Ten's hierarchy .

title: How the Aces defeated the Mercury
content: the no. 2 Las Vegas Aces beat the Phoenix Mercury 89-86 in game 1 of the 2025 WNBA Finals on friday . Dana Evans scored 21 points off the bench, matching the game high of four-time MVP A'ja Wilson and Mercury star Kahleah Copper . jewell Loyd also added 18 points, making them the first pair of teammates with at least 15 points as reserves in a Finals game since 2019 .

title: 'He fought too many times': How the loss to Ankalaev forced Pereira to change
content: former middleweight and then-light heavyweight champion Alex Pereira complained about how he felt ahead of his title defense . pereira surrendered the light heavyweight championship to Magomed Ankalaev by unanimous decision in an eff . he is now one of the world's most dominant champions of all time .

title: 13 more games, 13 matchup previews: We have predictions, picks and wild stats
content: quarterbacks QBs Baker Mayfield and Sam Darnold will face off again in the Bucs-Seahawks matchup . sports reporters take you inside the locker room with the best thing they heard this week . fantasy analyst Eric Moody shares fantasy football intel . we also have football power index (FPI) matchup quality ratings .

title: MLB playoff mega-preview: World Series odds, likely MVPs and more
content: the 2025 MLB playoffs are rolling along with all four game 1s starting Saturday . the playoffs will begin on saturday . all four teams will face each other in a series rematch . a team temperature is based on Bill James' formula for determining how "hot" or "cold" they are .

title: An all-time hater and a rivalry like no other: The Mannings vs. Florida
content: the longhorns have been a part of America's football consciousness for nearly 60 years . only one of the family's college football rivalries has included a spelling test, years of shade, and has spanned generations . the haters-in-chief, then as part of the redemptive end to the first college football run, was there .
